name: orchestrally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves music performed by an orchestra (= a large group of musicians who play many different instruments together and are led by a conductor): Chorally and orchestrally, it was a satisfying performance of this heart-warming opera. "Mahler, in his genius, captured the natural world orchestrally," Cooper said.
More examplesFewer examplesThe opera came to life orchestrally only in the final act.The composition of orchestrally accompanied church music began to decline.The music was more daring and varied orchestrally than his previous work.
